us.ba3.me

Class HaloPulse

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ba3.me.HaloPulse

  • public final class HaloPulse
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes an animated vector circle that can be added as a layer to highlight the location of vehicles or landmarks.

    This example will create a pulsing blue animated ring: 

     public void addOwnShipBeacon(){
        AnimatedVectorCircle c = new AnimatedVectorCircle();
        c.name = "locationRing";
        c.location = _currentSample.getLocation();
        c.minRadius = 5;
        c.maxRadius = 75;
        c.animationDuration = 2.5f;
        c.repeatDelay = 0;
        c.fade = true;
        c.fadeDelay = 1;
        c.zOrder = 999;
        c.lineStyle.strokeColor = Color.WHITE;
        c.lineStyle.outlineColor = Color.rgb(30, 144, 255);
        c.lineStyle.outlineWidth = 4;
        this._mapView.addAnimatedVectorCircle(c);
}

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float animationDuration
      The duration of the animation cycle.
      boolean fade
      If set to true, the circle will fade (alpha 1->0) linearly to invisible over the course of the animation.
      float fadeDelay
      The delay that occurs before the circle fades.
      LineStyle lineStyle
      Style with which to draw circle's path.
      Location location
      Initial location of the animated vector circle.
      float maxRadius
      The ending radius of the circle in screen points.
      float minRadius
      The starting radius of the circle in screen points.
      java.lang.String name
      Unique name of the animated vector circle.
      float repeatDelay
      The delay before the animation repeats.
      int segmentCount
      The number of segments that make up the circle.
      boolean useWorldSpace
      If set to YES, the circle radius is treated as nautical miles on the sphere.
      int zOrder
      The layering order relevant to other map and marker layers.

    • Field Detail

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        Unique name of the animated vector circle. This should not conflict with any map names as internally a vector map will be created based on this name.

      • location

        public Location location
        Initial location of the animated vector circle.

      • zOrder

        public int zOrder
        The layering order relevant to other map and marker layers.

      • lineStyle

        public LineStyle lineStyle
        Style with which to draw circle's path.

      • minRadius

        public float minRadius
        The starting radius of the circle in screen points.

      • maxRadius

        public float maxRadius
        The ending radius of the circle in screen points.

      • animationDuration

        public float animationDuration
        The duration of the animation cycle.

      • repeatDelay

        public float repeatDelay
        The delay before the animation repeats.

      • fadeDelay

        public float fadeDelay
        The delay that occurs before the circle fades.

      • fade

        public boolean fade
        If set to true, the circle will fade (alpha 1->0) linearly to invisible over the course of the animation.

      • segmentCount

        public int segmentCount
        The number of segments that make up the circle. The default is 36 (10 degrees per segment).

      • useWorldSpace

        public boolean useWorldSpace
        If set to YES, the circle radius is treated as nautical miles on the sphere. Otherwise, the radius is converted to screen-space. In screen space, the radius will be consistent across all zoom levels, in world space, the radius will 'stick' to a geographic distance. The default is false.

        public HaloPulse(HaloPulse circle)
